alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 29 at 8:02AM CST until November 30 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... White Oak Creek Near Talco affecting Morris, Franklin and Titus Counties. For the White Oak Creek...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Oak Creek Near Talco. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of creek bottoms. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the creek bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 7.2 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 815 AM CST.
